articles.title: Shut out: China virus pushes seriously ill to back of queue
articles.description: As focus turns to combating the coronavirus, people with life-threatening diseases say their needs are being neglected.

articles.author: Katrina Yu
articles.title: Coronavirus: China's once bustling cities come to a standstill
articles.description: The outbreak has brought the nation to a standstill as businesses remain closed and workers stay home.
articles.content:
China has announced 97 more deaths from coronavirus.
That brings the total number of dead to at least 1,115 people, with more than 44,000 others infected.
Al Jazeera's Katrina Yu reports from Beijing on how efforts to contain the outbreak have brought parts… [+31 chars]

articles.description: WHO says new coronavirus presents a 'grave threat' to world - here's the latest on how you can protect yourself.
articles.content:
A new coronavirus that emerged in China has killed more than 1,000 people, infected over 45,000 and spread to two dozen countries, prompting the United Nations health agency to declare the pathogen the "public enemy number one".

articles.author: Al Jazeera
articles.title: Sports events hit by coronavirus outbreak
articles.description: Deadly virus has forced Olympic qualifiers and major international competitions in China to be cancelled or relocated.
articles.content:
Many international sports events in China have been postponed, moved and even cancelled amid the novel coronavirus outbreak that has killed at least 1,113 people on the mainland and infected more than 45,000 people globally.
